data.title: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin step down after 21 years

data.title: Alphabet's new CEO Pichai now sole target on Google regulatory battles
data.text: Alphabet Inc's new chief executive, Sundar Pichai, will have the hot seat all to himself as regulators around the world investigate the company, U.S. politicians demand that it be broken up, and President Donald Trump accuses it of aiding his rivals.

data.title: MarketWatch First Take: What changes at Google with founders out? Nothing that hasn’t already changed

data.title: Sundar Pichai will have to step it up to become the wartime CEO Alphabet needs
data.text: As the company searches for its second act externally, and containing its culture internally, it needs a tough leader.

data.title: End of an Era: Larry Page and Sergey Brin Step Down at Alphabet
data.text: Google's parent company will turn to a familiar face for its new CEO.

data.title: Alphabet Leaders Page and Brin Step Down; Pichai to Be CEO
data.text: Larry Page and Sergey Brin, the founders of Google, will step down from their roles as chief executive officer and president of parent Alphabet Inc., the company said in a note on Tuesday. Bloomberg's Mark Bergen has more on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?"

data.title: Gene Munster: this was largely expected

data.title: Larry Page to step down as Alphabet CEO, Pichai to take over
data.text: Responding to the news that Larry Page will step down as Alphabet CEO and be replaced by Google CEO Sundar Pichai, who will also retain his position as head of Google.

data.title: Factbox: New Alphabet chief started at Google, made name with Android

data.title: Google Founders Larry Page And Sergey Brin Exit Alphabet Exec Suite, Hand CEO Reins To Google’s Sundar Pichai
data.text: Larry Page and Sergey Brin, the founders of Google, have left their executive roles at its parent company, Alphabet. Google CEO Sundar Pichai will become CEO of Alphabet while remaining chief at Google. Page had been CEO of Alphabet and Brin had been president. They will continue to be involved in the tech giant as shareholders

data.title: Google founders to step down from running Alphabet, put Pichai in charge
data.text: Alphabet Inc. will enter the 2020s without two leaders who have been a constant presence since Google was launched out of a Silicon Valley garage more than 20 years ago.

data.title: Google co-founders step aside as Pichai takes helm of parent Alphabet
data.text: Google Chief Executive Sundar Pichai will replace Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc , the company said in a blog post on Tuesday, reflecting the increasingly diminished public role of Page and Sergey Brin at the company they co-founded 21 years ago.

data.title: Sundar Pichai Named Alphabet CEO As Larry Page Exits, Google Stock Rises
data.text: Google-parent Alphabet said Chief Executive Larry Page will step down, with Google CEO Sundar Pichai replacing him. Google stock edged up in late trading.

data.title: Google’s Founders Step Aside as Sundar Pichai Takes Over Alphabet
data.text: Mr. Pichai, who has run Google for several years, replaces Larry Page, the co-founder of the company.

data.title: Larry Page steps down as CEO of Alphabet, hands control to Google CEO Sundar Pichai
data.text:
Google’s founders have no operational role though still control the company via their stock
Larry Page is no longer the CEO of Google’s parent company, Alphabet—and Sundar Pichai, who’s led Google since 2015, is taking his place.  Read Full Story

data.title: Google co-founder Larry Page stepping down as CEO of Alphabet
data.text: Larry Page, the cofounder of Google, is stepping down as CEO of its parent company Alphabet. Sundar Pichai, the current CEO of Google and a longtime executive at the company, will take over as CEO of Alphabet in addition to his current role, Alphabet announced Tuesday afternoon.

data.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai is taking over as CEO of Alphabet, too
data.text: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin just announced that Google CEO Sundar Pichai will be replacing Page as the CEO of parent company Alphabet. Alphabet first came into existence in 2015 as “a collection of companies” that included Google but also other organizations like Waymo (self-driving cars), Verily (life sciences) and Calico (biotech R&D).

data.title: Google under fire: four employees charge unfair labor practices
data.text:
Google’s anti-union management practices implode
The PR team at Alphabet, the parent company of Google, is going to be busy this week—the four employees that Google fired last week are filing a complaint of unfair labor practices with the National Labor Relations Board, and receiving extensive national press coverage for their efforts.  Read Full Story
